p: A population model of I. scapularis that incorporated known impacts of temperature on the tick was used to predict the geographic occurrence of current climatic suitability, as well as project future climatic suitability in Canada ( Ogden et al. 2006b). These tended to corroborate projections based on a statistical “environmental niche” model for this tick ( Brownstein et al. 2005). Field studies in 2007 to validate the model predictions detected that incursion of the tick had begun ( Ogden et al. 2008b).
